meanings.definition: Civilian clothes worn by someone who is not in the military.
meanings.sent1: She wore her civvies to the party instead of her uniform.
meanings.sent2: On weekends, he prefers to relax in his civvies rather than his work attire.
meanings.sent3: The cat somehow ended up wearing civvies after playing in the laundry pile.
meanings.sent4: Her civvies were like a shield against the strict dress code of the office.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of her civvies made her stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: A person who is not in the military.
meanings.sent1: The town's mayor was a civvies who had never served in the armed forces.
meanings.sent2: The school invited civvies to speak about their experiences in different professions.
meanings.sent3: The civvies at the meeting had diverse backgrounds and perspectives.
meanings.sent4: As a civvies, he approached problem-solving from a unique angle.
meanings.sent5: The civvies in the room were eager to learn about military life.
